article:
Chengiz
================

Chengiz is a 2023 Indian Bengali-language historical drama film directed by Raj Chakraborty and produced by Dev Entertainment Ventures. The film is based on the life of the Bengali revolutionary, Khudiram Bose, and his involvement in the Indian independence movement. The movie stars Dev, Rukmini Maitra, and Subhashree Ganguly in lead roles.

Plot
-----

The film is set in the early 20th century and revolves around the life of Khudiram Bose, a young Bengali revolutionary who becomes involved in the Indian independence movement against British colonial rule. The story follows Khudiram's transformation from a common man to a freedom fighter, as he witnesses the atrocities committed by the British and decides to take a stand against them.

The film explores Khudiram's relationships with his family and friends, as well as his encounters with other revolutionaries, including Prafulla Chaki and Bagha Jatin. The movie also delves into the personal struggles and sacrifices made by Khudiram and his fellow revolutionaries in their fight for independence.

Cast
-----

* Dev as Khudiram Bose
* Rukmini Maitra as Priya
* Subhashree Ganguly as Leela
* Saurav Das as Prafulla Chaki
* Joy Mukherjee as Bagha Jatin
* Kharaj Mukherjee as Khudiram's father
* Bhola Tamang as a British officer

Production
------------

### Development and Pre-production

The idea for Chengiz was first conceived by director Raj Chakraborty in 2019, when he began researching the life of Khudiram Bose and the Indian independence movement. Chakraborty was fascinated by Khudiram's story and saw potential for a film that would showcase the struggles and sacrifices made by Bengali revolutionaries during that period.

After several months of research and script development, Chakraborty approached producer Dev with the idea for the film. Dev was impressed by the script and agreed to produce the movie under his banner, Dev Entertainment Ventures.

### Casting

The casting process for Chengiz began in early 2020, with Dev being the first actor to be cast in the lead role of Khudiram Bose. Rukmini Maitra and Subhashree Ganguly were later cast as the female leads, while Saurav Das, Joy Mukherjee, and Kharaj Mukherjee were cast in supporting roles.

Soundtrack
------------

The soundtrack for Chengiz was composed by Indraadip Dasgupta, with lyrics written by Srijit Mukherji and Priyo Chatterjee. The album features five tracks, including the title song "Chengiz", which was released as a single in February 2023.

Marketing
------------

The marketing campaign for Chengiz began in January 2023, with the release of a teaser trailer that showcased the film's historical setting and action sequences. The trailer received a positive response from audiences and generated buzz around the movie.

In the following weeks, the film's cast and crew participated in several promotional events, including press conferences and interviews. The movie's social media accounts were also active, with regular updates and behind-the-scenes content being shared with fans.

Release
---------

### Theatrical

Chengiz was released in theaters on March 17, 2023, in West Bengal and other parts of India. The film received a wide release, with over 200 screens in West Bengal alone.

### Screenings and statistics

Chengiz was screened at several film festivals, including the Kolkata International Film Festival and the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne. The movie also received a special screening at the Indian Parliament in New Delhi, which was attended by several politicians and dignitaries.

According to box office reports, Chengiz opened to a strong start, with collections of over â¹1 crore on its opening day in West Bengal. The film went on to gross over â¹5 crore in its opening weekend, making it one of the highest-grossing Bengali films of 2023.

Reception
------------

### Critical response

Chengiz received generally positive reviews from critics, with praise for its historical setting, action sequences, and performances. The film's direction and screenplay were also commended, with several critics noting that the movie was a fitting tribute to Khudiram Bose and the Indian independence movement.

However, some critics felt that the film's pacing was uneven and that the supporting characters were underdeveloped. The movie's music and cinematography were also praised, with several critics noting that the film's visuals and sound design were of high quality.

### Box office

As of April 2023, Chengiz has grossed over â¹10 crore at the box office, making it one of the highest-grossing Bengali films of 2023. The movie's success can be attributed to its strong word-of-mouth and positive reviews from critics.

October 2022 Conservative Party leadership election

The October 2022 Conservative Party leadership election was a leadership election held by the Conservative Party in the United Kingdom to elect a new leader to succeed Liz Truss, who resigned as party leader and Prime Minister of the United Kingdom on 20 October 2022. The election was won by Rishi Sunak, who became the new leader of the Conservative Party and Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

# Background

## Boris Johnson premiership and scandals

Boris Johnson had been the leader of the Conservative Party and Prime Minister of the United Kingdom since July 2019. During his premiership, Johnson faced several scandals, including the Partygate scandal, in which he was accused of breaching COVID-19 lockdown rules. Johnson also faced criticism for his handling of the economy, the COVID-19 pandemic, and the Ukraine-Russia conflict.

## Leadership election to succeed Johnson

In July 2022, Johnson announced his resignation as leader of the Conservative Party, triggering a leadership election. The election was contested by several candidates, including Liz Truss, Rishi Sunak, and Penny Mordaunt. Truss won the election, becoming the new leader of the Conservative Party and Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

## Liz Truss premiership and scandals

Liz Truss's premiership was marked by controversy and scandal. She faced criticism for her economic policies, including a mini-budget that sparked a financial crisis. Truss also faced criticism for her handling of the energy crisis and her decision to appoint Suella Braverman as Home Secretary.

## Calls for Truss's resignation

In October 2022, Truss faced growing calls for her resignation, including from within her own party. The Conservative Party was trailing in the polls, and many MPs were concerned about the party's prospects at the next general election.

## Resignations and vote on fracking

On 19 October 2022, Suella Braverman resigned as Home Secretary, citing concerns about Truss's leadership. The same day, the Conservative Party was defeated in a vote on fracking, which was seen as a major embarrassment for the government.

## Liz Truss resigns

On 20 October 2022, Liz Truss announced her resignation as leader of the Conservative Party and Prime Minister of the United Kingdom. The resignation triggered a new leadership election, which would be contested by several candidates.

# Campaign

The campaign for the October 2022 Conservative Party leadership election began on 20 October 2022, when Liz Truss announced her resignation. The campaign was marked by a series of hustings events, in which the candidates debated and answered questions from party members.

# Election process

The election process for the October 2022 Conservative Party leadership election was similar to that used in previous leadership elections. The candidates were required to secure the support of at least 100 MPs to enter the contest. The party members then voted on the candidates, with the winner being the candidate who secured the most votes.

# Candidates

## Declared

The following candidates declared their intention to stand in the election:

* Rishi Sunak, former Chancellor of the Exchequer
* Penny Mordaunt, Leader of the House of Commons
* Boris Johnson, former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom
* Suella Braverman, former Home Secretary
* Kemi Badenoch, former Secretary of State for International Trade

## Withdrawn

The following candidates withdrew from the contest:

* Suella Braverman, former Home Secretary
* Kemi Badenoch, former Secretary of State for International Trade

## Explored

The following candidates explored standing in the election but ultimately decided not to:

* Michael Gove, former Secretary of State for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities
* Dominic Raab, former Deputy Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

## Declined

The following candidates declined to stand in the election:

* Liz Truss, former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom
* Theresa May, former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

## Endorsements

The following candidates received endorsements from prominent Conservative Party figures:

* Rishi Sunak: received endorsements from several senior MPs, including Jeremy Hunt and Sajid Javid
* Penny Mordaunt: received endorsements from several MPs, including Andrea Leadsom and Chris Heaton-Harris
* Boris Johnson: received endorsements from several MPs, including Jacob Rees-Mogg and Nadine Dorries

# Responses

The October 2022 Conservative Party leadership election received significant media coverage, with many commentators analyzing the candidates and their chances of success. The election also sparked a lively debate on social media, with many users discussing the candidates and their policies.

# Polling

## Conservative members

A series of polls were conducted among Conservative Party members to gauge their preferences for the next leader. The polls showed Rishi Sunak to be the clear frontrunner, with Penny Mordaunt in second place.

## 2019 Conservative voters

A series of polls were conducted among voters who supported the Conservative Party at the 2019 general election. The polls showed Rishi Sunak to be the most popular candidate, with Penny Mordaunt in second place.

## General population

A series of polls were conducted among the general population to gauge their views on the candidates. The polls showed Rishi Sunak to be the most popular candidate, with Penny Mordaunt in second place.

The October 2022 Conservative Party leadership election was won by Rishi Sunak, who became the new leader of the Conservative Party and Prime Minister of the United Kingdom. The election marked a significant shift in the party's leadership and policy direction, and will likely have a significant impact on the party's prospects at the next general election.

article:
The Aesthetics of Resistance
==========================

The Aesthetics of Resistance is a novel by German writer Peter Weiss, published between 1975 and 1981. The novel is a sprawling, complex work that defies easy categorization, blending elements of historical fiction, philosophical treatise, and personal memoir. Spanning over 1,000 pages, it is considered one of the most ambitious and important works of 20th-century German literature.

Plot
-----

The Aesthetics of Resistance is set in the 1930s and 1940s, against the backdrop of the rise of fascism in Europe. The novel follows a group of young, working-class men in Berlin, who are drawn into the anti-fascist resistance movement. As the story unfolds, the characters find themselves increasingly embroiled in the struggles of the time, from the Spanish Civil War to the early years of World War II.

The novel's narrative is non-linear, jumping back and forth in time and blurring the lines between reality and fiction. Weiss's characters are often fragmented and disjointed, reflecting the chaos and dislocation of the era. Through their experiences, Weiss explores themes of resistance, revolution, and the role of art in shaping our understanding of the world.

Form features and structure
---------------------------

The Aesthetics of Resistance is divided into three volumes, each with its own distinct structure and narrative focus. The novel is characterized by its use of multiple narrative voices, including first-person and third-person narration, as well as extensive use of dialogue and internal monologue.

The novel's structure is also notable for its use of montage, a technique borrowed from film and avant-garde art. Weiss juxtaposes disparate elements â historical events, personal anecdotes, philosophical musings â to create a kaleidoscopic portrait of the era. This approach allows Weiss to convey the complexity and multiplicity of human experience, as well as the interconnectedness of historical events.

History of origins and publication
---------------------------------

### Beginning

Weiss began working on The Aesthetics of Resistance in the early 1960s, during a period of intense creative ferment. He was drawn to the subject of anti-fascist resistance, inspired by his own experiences as a young man in Sweden during World War II.

Anti-Soviet Resistance by the Ukrainian Insurgent Army

The Ukrainian Insurgent Army (UPA) was a Ukrainian nationalist organization that engaged in armed resistance against the Soviet Union during World War II and the post-war period. The UPA was formed in 1942 as a military wing of the Organization of Ukrainian Nationalists (OUN), which had been fighting for Ukrainian independence since the 1920s. This article provides an overview of the UPA's anti-Soviet resistance, from its creation to its final suppression in the late 1940s.

# Background

## Organization of Ukrainian Nationalists

The Organization of Ukrainian Nationalists (OUN) was a Ukrainian nationalist organization founded in 1929 by a group of Ukrainian intellectuals and politicians. The OUN's primary goal was to achieve Ukrainian independence from Poland and the Soviet Union, which had occupied Ukraine since the end of World War I. The OUN was influenced by fascist and nationalist ideologies, and its leaders, including Stepan Bandera, were known for their radical views.

## Outbreak of the war

In September 1939, Germany and the Soviet Union invaded Poland, which led to the division of Ukraine between the two powers. The OUN saw this as an opportunity to promote Ukrainian independence and began to cooperate with the Germans. However, the OUN's relationship with the Germans was complicated, and the organization's leaders were eventually arrested and imprisoned.

## Creation of OUN-B, pogroms, and anti-Soviet uprising

In 1940, a faction of the OUN, known as OUN-B, was formed, led by Stepan Bandera. OUN-B was more radical than the original OUN and advocated for the use of violence to achieve Ukrainian independence. In June 1941, Germany launched a surprise attack on the Soviet Union, and the OUN-B saw this as an opportunity to launch an anti-Soviet uprising. The OUN-B organized a series of pogroms against Jews and other minorities, which led to the deaths of tens of thousands of people.

The UPA's primary goal was to fight against the Soviet Union and establish an independent Ukrainian state. # Definition and classification

Lakota religion is a form of indigenous spirituality that belongs to the broader category of Native American religions. It is a distinct tradition that has developed among the Lakota people, who are a confederation of seven related tribes: the Oglala, Brule, Hunkpapa, Miniconjou, Sans Arc, Sisseton, and Oohenunpa. Lakota religion is often classified as a form of animism, as it recognizes the presence of spirits and supernatural powers in the natural world.

article:
SDG Publishers Compact
=====================

The SDG Publishers Compact is a collaborative initiative between publishers and the United Nations (UN) to support the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The Compact aims to accelerate progress towards the SDGs by harnessing the power of publishing to promote knowledge sharing, education, and awareness-raising.

# Formation

The SDG Publishers Compact was launched in 2020 by the UN and the International Publishers Association (IPA) to bring together publishers from around the world to support the SDGs. The Compact is an outgrowth of the UN's recognition of the critical role that publishers play in disseminating knowledge and promoting education, which are essential for achieving the SDGs.

# Commitments

Publishers who join the Compact commit to:

* Support the SDGs through their publishing activities
* Promote the SDGs through their publications and communication channels
* Develop sustainable business practices that align with the SDGs
* Share knowledge and best practices with other publishers and stakeholders

# Signatories

The Compact has attracted a diverse range of signatories from the publishing industry, including major publishers, academic publishers, and independent publishers. Signatories come from all regions of the world, reflecting the global nature of the publishing industry and the SDGs.

# Fellows

The Compact has also established a fellowship program to support young publishers and publishing professionals who are working on SDG-related projects. The fellowship program provides training, mentorship, and funding to support the development of innovative publishing projects that promote the SDGs.

# Actions

The SDG Publishers Compact has a range of actions aimed at promoting the SDGs through publishing. These actions can be grouped into three categories: discursive effects, normative effects, and institutional effects.

## Discursive effects

The Compact aims to promote a global conversation about the SDGs through publishing. This includes publishing books, journals, and other materials that highlight the importance of the SDGs and provide guidance on how to achieve them. The Compact also supports the development of new publishing formats and platforms that can reach new audiences and promote the SDGs in innovative ways.

## Normative effects

The Compact aims to promote a culture of sustainability within the publishing industry. This includes developing sustainable business practices that reduce the environmental impact of publishing, promoting diversity and inclusion within the industry, and supporting the development of publishing policies and standards that align with the SDGs.

## Institutional effects

The Compact aims to promote institutional change within the publishing industry to support the SDGs. This includes developing new publishing models and business structures that prioritize sustainability and social impact, promoting collaboration and partnerships between publishers and other stakeholders, and supporting the development of new publishing technologies and platforms that can promote the SDGs.

### Publishing

The Compact has a range of initiatives aimed at promoting sustainable publishing practices. These include:

#### Carbon-neutral

The Compact supports the development of carbon-neutral publishing practices, including the use of renewable energy, reducing waste and emissions, and offsetting carbon emissions through carbon offsetting schemes.

#### Open access

The Compact promotes open access publishing, which makes research and knowledge freely available to all. This includes supporting open access journals, books, and other publications, as well as promoting open access policies and standards within the publishing industry.

#### Discounted fees

The Compact supports the development of discounted fees for publishing services, including editing, proofreading, and design. This aims to make publishing more accessible and affordable for authors and researchers from low-income countries and backgrounds.

### Publications

The Compact has a range of initiatives aimed at promoting SDG-related publications. These include:

#### Diversity and inclusivity

The Compact promotes diversity and inclusivity within publishing, including promoting publications by authors from diverse backgrounds and perspectives, and supporting the development of publishing policies and standards that promote diversity and inclusion.

#### Editorial structure

The Compact supports the development of editorial structures that promote the SDGs, including editorial boards, peer review processes, and editorial policies that prioritize sustainability and social impact.

#### Curation

The Compact promotes the curation of SDG-related publications, including the development of curated lists, collections, and series that highlight the importance of the SDGs and provide guidance on how to achieve them.

#### Creation

The Compact supports the creation of new SDG-related publications, including books, journals, and other materials that provide innovative solutions and approaches to achieving the SDGs.

#### Journals

The Compact supports the development of SDG-related journals, including journals that focus on specific SDGs or themes, and journals that promote interdisciplinary and transdisciplinary research and approaches.

#### Communication skills

The Compact promotes the development of communication skills within the publishing industry, including training and capacity-building programs that support the development of effective communication and outreach strategies.

* Sustainable Development Goals
* United Nations
* International Publishers Association
* Open access publishing
* Carbon-neutral publishing
* Diversity and inclusion in publishing

Mug Shot of Donald Trump

The mug shot of Donald Trump, the 45th President of the United States, was taken on August 24, 2023, at the Fulton County Jail in Atlanta, Georgia. The image was released to the public after Trump's indictment and arrest in connection with his alleged role in attempting to overturn the 2020 presidential election results in Georgia. The mug shot has since become a widely discussed and shared image, sparking various reactions and uses.

#Background

The mug shot was taken as part of the standard booking process after Trump's arrest. The image shows Trump facing forward, with a neutral expression, and wearing a suit and tie. The photo is a standard, unsmiling, and straightforward image, consistent with the typical format of mug shots.

Trump's arrest and indictment were the result of a lengthy investigation into his alleged attempts to influence the outcome of the 2020 presidential election in Georgia. The charges against him include racketeering, conspiracy, and other related offenses. The case has drawn significant national attention and has been seen as a major development in the ongoing controversy surrounding Trump's post-presidency.

#Usage

The mug shot of Donald Trump has been widely used and shared across various platforms, including social media, news outlets, and fundraising campaigns.

##Fundraising

The image has been used by various Democratic-leaning organizations and individuals to raise funds for their campaigns and causes. The mug shot has been featured on merchandise, such as t-shirts, stickers, and buttons, with slogans like "Lock Him Up" and "Indictment Day." These fundraising efforts aim to capitalize on the public's interest in the image and the controversy surrounding Trump's arrest.

Some organizations have used the image to promote their advocacy work, such as voting rights and election reform initiatives. By leveraging the widespread attention and interest in the mug shot, these groups aim to raise awareness and mobilize support for their causes.

##News coverage

The mug shot has been extensively covered by news outlets, with many publishing the image alongside articles and analysis of Trump's arrest and indictment. The image has been used to illustrate the significance of the event and to provide a visual representation of the story.

Some news outlets have used the image to create interactive features, such as quizzes and polls, that allow readers to engage with the story. Others have used the image to create memes and humorous content, which have been widely shared on social media.

#Reactions

The release of the mug shot has sparked a range of reactions from the public, politicians, and pundits.

Some have seen the image as a symbol of accountability and justice, arguing that it represents a long-overdue reckoning for Trump's alleged wrongdoing. Others have criticized the release of the image, arguing that it is an invasion of Trump's privacy and a form of "public shaming."

Trump himself has responded to the image, claiming that it is "fake" and that the charges against him are "politically motivated." His supporters have also rallied around him, arguing that the image is a form of "harassment" and that Trump is being unfairly targeted.

article:
Sun Belt

The Sun Belt is a region in the United States that has experienced significant population growth and economic development since the mid-20th century. Stretching across the southern and southwestern parts of the country, the Sun Belt has become a major driver of the US economy and a hub for various industries, including technology, healthcare, and tourism.

# Migration

The Sun Belt's growth can be attributed, in part, to the large-scale migration of people from other parts of the country. Many Americans were drawn to the region's warm climate, affordable cost of living, and abundant job opportunities. This migration pattern, which began in the post-World War II era, has continued to shape the demographics and economy of the Sun Belt.

## Domestic Migration

Between 1950 and 1990, the Sun Belt states experienced a significant influx of migrants from other parts of the country. Many of these migrants came from the Northeast and Midwest, where industries such as manufacturing were declining. The Sun Belt's growing economy, driven by industries like technology and healthcare, offered new opportunities for employment and economic advancement.

## International Migration

In addition to domestic migration, the Sun Belt has also experienced significant international migration. Many immigrants have been drawn to the region's urban centers, such as Miami, Los Angeles, and Houston, which offer a range of economic and cultural opportunities. The Sun Belt is home to some of the largest Hispanic and Latino populations in the country, with many immigrants coming from countries like Mexico, Cuba, and Puerto Rico.

# Definition

The Sun Belt is a broad geographic region that encompasses parts of the southern and southwestern United States. While there is no universally accepted definition of the Sun Belt, it is generally considered to include the states of Arizona, California, Florida, Georgia, Louisiana, Mississippi, Nevada, New Mexico, North Carolina, Oklahoma, South Carolina, Tennessee, Texas, and Utah.

## Regional Subdivisions

The Sun Belt can be further subdivided into several regions, each with its own unique cultural and economic characteristics. These regions include:

* The Southwest: Arizona, Nevada, New Mexico, and Utah
* The Southeast: Florida, Georgia, Louisiana, Mississippi, North Carolina, and South Carolina
* The Gulf Coast: Texas, Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, and Florida
* California and the West Coast: California, Oregon, and Washington

# Projections

The Sun Belt is expected to continue growing in the coming decades, with many of its states projected to experience significant population increases. According to the US Census Bureau, the Sun Belt states are expected to account for a disproportionate share of the country's population growth between 2020 and 2030.

## Population Growth

The Sun Belt's population is projected to grow from approximately 140 million in 2020 to over 170 million by 2030. This growth will be driven by a combination of natural increase (births minus deaths) and migration. Many of the Sun Belt states are expected to experience significant population increases, with Texas, Florida, and California leading the way.

## Economic Growth

The Sun Belt's economy is also expected to continue growing, driven by industries like technology, healthcare, and tourism. The region is home to many of the country's leading technology hubs, including Silicon Valley in California and the Research Triangle in North Carolina. The Sun Belt is also a major center for international trade, with many of its ports and airports serving as critical gateways for global commerce.

# Politics

The Sun Belt has played an increasingly important role in US politics in recent decades. Many of the region's states are considered swing states, and the Sun Belt has been a key battleground in presidential elections.

## Electoral Politics

The Sun Belt states have a significant number of electoral votes, making the region a critical component of any presidential campaign. In recent elections, the Sun Belt has been a key battleground, with candidates from both parties competing for votes in states like Florida, Texas, and North Carolina.

## Policy Issues

The Sun Belt is home to a diverse range of policy issues, reflecting the region's unique cultural and economic characteristics. Some of the key policy issues in the Sun Belt include:

* Immigration reform: The Sun Belt is home to many immigrants, and the region has been at the forefront of the debate over immigration reform.
* Healthcare: The Sun Belt has been a leader in the development of the healthcare industry, and the region is home to many of the country's top hospitals and medical research centers.
* Education: The Sun Belt is home to many of the country's top universities, and the region has been a leader in education reform efforts.

# Environment

The Sun Belt is characterized by a diverse range of environmental ecosystems, including deserts, forests, and coastal regions. The region is also home to many of the country's most significant environmental challenges, including climate change, air and water pollution, and habitat destruction.

## Climate Change

The Sun Belt is particularly vulnerable to the impacts of climate change, including rising temperatures, drought, and extreme weather events. Many of the region's cities are also experiencing significant air and water pollution, which can have serious health impacts for residents.

## Conservation Efforts

The Sun Belt is home to many conservation efforts, aimed at protecting the region's natural ecosystems and promoting sustainable development. Some of the key conservation efforts in the Sun Belt include:

* The creation of national parks and wildlife refuges: The Sun Belt is home to many of the country's most iconic national parks, including the Grand Canyon and Yellowstone.
* The protection of endangered species: The Sun Belt is home to many endangered species, including the Florida panther and the California condor.

# Major cities

The Sun Belt is home to many of the country's largest and most vibrant cities. Some of the major cities in the Sun Belt include:

* Los Angeles, California: The second-largest city in the US, Los Angeles is a hub for the entertainment industry and a major center for international trade.
* Houston, Texas: The fourth-largest city in the US, Houston is a major center for the energy industry and a hub for international trade.
* Miami, Florida: A major center for international trade and finance, Miami is also a hub for the tourism industry.
* Phoenix, Arizona: A major center for the technology industry, Phoenix is also a hub for healthcare and education.

Organized Crime in London, Ontario

Organized crime in London, Ontario, has a long and complex history, with various groups and individuals involved in a range of illicit activities. From bank robbers and motorcycle clubs to street gangs and crime syndicates, London has been a hub for organized crime in Canada. This article provides an overview of the history of organized crime in London, major events, and notable groups and individuals involved.

# Overview

London, Ontario, is a city with a population of approximately 400,000 people, located in southwestern Ontario. The city's strategic location, with access to major highways and the Canada-US border, has made it an attractive location for organized crime groups. London's organized crime scene is diverse, with various groups involved in activities such as extortion, narcotics trafficking, and violent crime.

# Early History

## Bank Robbers

2022 Northern Ireland Assembly election

The 2022 Northern Ireland Assembly election was held on 5 May 2022 to elect the 90 members of the Northern Ireland Assembly, which is the devolved legislature of Northern Ireland. The election was the seventh since the establishment of the Assembly in 1998.

# Background

## Electoral events

The election was held under the single transferable vote (STV) system, with 18 constituencies each electing five members. The Assembly's term was due to expire on 27 March 2023, but the election was called early due to a political crisis. The previous Assembly election was held in 2017, but the Assembly was suspended for three years due to a dispute between the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) and Sinn FÃ©in over issues such as same-sex marriage and the Irish language.

## Leadership changes

In the period leading up to the election, there were significant leadership changes within the main parties. In April 2021, Edwin Poots was elected as the new leader of the DUP, succeeding Arlene Foster. However, Poots resigned as leader after just 21 days, and was succeeded by Jeffrey Donaldson. In November 2021, Mary Lou McDonald announced that she would be stepping down as leader of Sinn FÃ©in in Northern Ireland, and was succeeded by Michelle O'Neill.

## Northern Ireland Protocol

The Northern Ireland Protocol, which is part of the Brexit withdrawal agreement, was a major issue in the election campaign. The protocol created a customs border in the Irish Sea, which was opposed by unionist parties. The DUP and other unionist parties argued that the protocol undermined the Good Friday Agreement and threatened the Union.

## Calls for early election

In February 2022, the DUP withdrew its First Minister from the Northern Ireland Executive, citing opposition to the Northern Ireland Protocol. This move triggered a crisis, and there were calls for an early election. On 28 February, the Secretary of State for Northern Ireland, Brandon Lewis, announced that an election would be held on 5 May.

# Candidates

A total of 239 candidates stood in the election, representing 17 parties. The main parties contesting the election were the DUP, Sinn FÃ©in, the Ulster Unionist Party (UUP), the Social Democratic and Labour Party (SDLP), and the Alliance Party.

# Members not seeking re-election

# Campaign

The election campaign focused on issues such as the Northern Ireland Protocol, the economy, and healthcare. The DUP and other unionist parties campaigned on a platform of opposition to the protocol, while Sinn FÃ©in and other nationalist parties argued that the protocol was necessary to protect the Good Friday Agreement.

# Opinion polls

# Results

2022 Pacific Hurricane Season

The 2022 Pacific hurricane season was the period of time in which tropical cyclones formed in the eastern Pacific Ocean, specifically within the area bounded by the 140Â°W meridian and the western coast of the Americas. The season officially began on May 15, 2022, and ended on November 30, 2022. During this time, 20 named storms, 10 hurricanes, and 4 major hurricanes developed in the basin.

# Seasonal forecasts

Before the start of the 2022 Pacific hurricane season, several organizations and meteorological agencies released their forecasts for the upcoming season. The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) predicted a 60% chance of an above-normal season, with 15-20 named storms, 7-10 hurricanes, and 3-5 major hurricanes. The Climate Prediction Center (CPC) also forecasted an above-normal season, with 16-21 named storms, 8-11 hurricanes, and 3-5 major hurricanes.

# Seasonal summary

The 2022 Pacific hurricane season was marked by a significant increase in activity compared to the 2021 season. A total of 20 named storms developed, with 10 of these storms reaching hurricane strength. Four of the hurricanes reached major hurricane strength, which is classified as a Category 3 or higher on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Wind Scale. The season saw a few notable storms, including Hurricane Agatha, which made landfall in Mexico as a Category 2 hurricane, and Hurricane Orlene, which brought strong winds and heavy rainfall to the western coast of Mexico.

# Systems

## Hurricane Agatha

Hurricane Agatha was the first named storm of the 2022 Pacific hurricane season. It formed on May 28, 2022, as a tropical depression off the coast of Mexico. The system quickly intensified into a tropical storm and then a hurricane, reaching peak winds of 110 mph (180 km/h). Agatha made landfall in the state of Oaxaca, Mexico, on May 30, causing significant damage and flooding.

## Hurricane Blas

Hurricane Blas formed on June 14, 2022, as a tropical depression in the eastern Pacific. The system strengthened into a tropical storm and then a hurricane, reaching peak winds of 120 mph (195 km/h). Blas remained at sea, passing south of the Baja California Peninsula.

## Tropical Storm Celia

Tropical Storm Celia formed on June 24, 2022, as a tropical depression in the eastern Pacific. The system strengthened into a tropical storm, reaching peak winds of 50 mph (85 km/h). Celia dissipated on June 28, without affecting any landmasses.

## Hurricane Bonnie

Hurricane Bonnie formed on July 2, 2022, as a tropical depression in the eastern Pacific. The system strengthened into a tropical storm and then a hurricane, reaching peak winds of 100 mph (160 km/h). Bonnie passed south of the Baja California Peninsula, bringing strong winds and heavy rainfall to the region.

Hurricane Darby formed on July 9, 2022, as a tropical depression in the eastern Pacific. The system strengthened into a tropical storm and then a hurricane, reaching peak winds of 115 mph (185 km/h). Darby remained at sea, passing south of the Hawaiian Islands.

Hurricane Estelle formed on July 14, 2022, as a tropical depression in the eastern Pacific. Estelle passed south of the Baja California Peninsula, bringing strong winds and heavy rainfall to the region.

article:
Laal Singh Chaddha is a 2022 Indian Hindi-language comedy-drama film directed by Advait Chandan and written by Atul Kulkarni. The film is an adaptation of the 1994 American film Forrest Gump, which was based on Winston Groom's 1986 novel of the same name. Laal Singh Chaddha stars Aamir Khan, Kareena Kapoor, Naga Chaitanya, and Mona Singh, and follows the life of Laal Singh Chaddha, a man with a low IQ who finds himself involved in some of the most significant events of Indian history.

# Plot

The film tells the story of Laal Singh Chaddha, a man from Punjab who is born with a low IQ. Despite his physical and mental limitations, Laal is a kind-hearted and optimistic person who always tries to do the right thing. As Laal grows up, he finds himself involved in some of the most significant events of Indian history, including the Indian independence movement, the Partition of India, and the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971.

Through his journey, Laal meets various people who shape his life, including his childhood friend Rupa and his love interest, Rupa's sister. Laal also becomes friends with Bala, a young boy who is affected by the Partition of India. Together, Laal and Bala go on to achieve great things, including winning a medal in the Indian Army and becoming a successful businessman.

Throughout the film, Laal's innocence and good intentions often lead him into trouble, but he always manages to find a way out. The film ends with Laal reflecting on his life and the lessons he has learned along the way.

ICC Men's T20 World Cup

The ICC Men's T20 World Cup is an international Twenty20 cricket tournament organized by the International Cricket Council (ICC), the governing body of cricket. The tournament was first held in 2007 and has since become a premier international cricket event.

# History

## Background

The concept of a Twenty20 World Cup was first proposed by the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) in 2005, with the aim of creating a shorter, more exciting format of the game. The idea was met with enthusiasm by the ICC, which saw an opportunity to attract new fans to the sport.

### Domestic tournaments

The first Twenty20 domestic tournament, the Twenty20 Cup, was held in England in 2003. The tournament was a huge success, and similar competitions were soon established in other countries, such as India's Indian Premier League (IPL) and Australia's Big Bash League (BBL).

### Twenty20 Internationals

The first Twenty20 International (T20I) match was played between Australia and New Zealand in 2005. The format quickly gained popularity, and by 2007, most Test-playing nations had played T20I matches.

## Inaugural edition

The first ICC Men's T20 World Cup was held in 2007 in South Africa. The tournament featured 12 teams, including all Test-playing nations and several associate members. The tournament was won by India, who defeated Pakistan in the final by five runs.

## Expansion to 16 teams

In 2012, the ICC announced that the tournament would be expanded to 16 teams, with the inclusion of four additional associate members. This change was made to give more opportunities to smaller cricketing nations.

## Expansion to 20 teams

In 2020, the ICC announced that the tournament would be further expanded to 20 teams, with the inclusion of four additional associate members. This change was made to give even more opportunities to smaller cricketing nations and to increase the global reach of the tournament.

Tropical Cyclones in 2022

Tropical cyclones are low-pressure systems that form over warm ocean waters in the tropics. These storms can bring catastrophic winds, rainfall, and storm surges that can affect millions of people worldwide. The year 2022 saw a significant number of tropical cyclones form across the globe, resulting in loss of life and property damage. This article provides an overview of the global atmospheric and hydrological conditions, a summary of the tropical cyclones that occurred in each basin, and a detailed list of the systems that formed during the year.

# Global atmospheric and hydrological conditions

The global atmospheric and hydrological conditions in 2022 were influenced by several climate patterns, including the El NiÃ±o-Southern Oscillation (ENSO), the Indian Ocean Dipole (IOD), and the Madden-Julian Oscillation (MJO). These patterns can impact the formation and trajectory of tropical cyclones. The ENSO cycle was in a neutral phase during the first half of the year, but transitioned to a weak El NiÃ±o event in the second half. The IOD was also in a neutral phase for most of the year, but a positive phase developed in the latter part of the year. The MJO was active throughout the year, with several events occurring in the tropics.

# Summary

## North Atlantic Ocean

The North Atlantic hurricane season was near average in terms of activity, with 14 named storms, 8 hurricanes, and 2 major hurricanes. The most notable storm of the season was Hurricane Fiona, which became a Category 4 hurricane and caused significant damage in Puerto Rico and the Dominican Republic.

## Eastern & Central Pacific Ocean

The Eastern Pacific hurricane season was above average in terms of activity, with 19 named storms, 10 hurricanes, and 4 major hurricanes. The most notable storm of the season was Hurricane Darby, which became a Category 4 hurricane and caused significant damage in Mexico.

## Western Pacific Ocean

The Western Pacific typhoon season was above average in terms of activity, with 27 named storms, 15 typhoons, and 5 super typhoons. The most notable storm of the season was Super Typhoon Hinnamnor, which became a Category 5-equivalent typhoon and caused significant damage in Japan and South Korea.

## North Indian Ocean

The North Indian Ocean cyclone season was below average in terms of activity, with 4 named storms and 2 cyclonic storms. The most notable storm of the season was Cyclone Sitrang, which caused significant damage in Bangladesh and India.

## South-West Indian Ocean

### January - June

The first half of the year saw several tropical cyclones form in the South-West Indian Ocean, including Tropical Storm Dumako and Tropical Storm Fezile.

### July - December

The second half of the year saw several tropical cyclones form in the South-West Indian Ocean, including Tropical Cyclone Batsirai and Intense Tropical Cyclone Freddy.

## Australian Region

The Australian region cyclone season was above average in terms of activity, with 27 named storms, 15 tropical cyclones, and 5 severe tropical cyclones.

### January - June

The first half of the year saw several tropical cyclones form in the Australian region, including Tropical Cyclone Seth and Tropical Cyclone Tiffany.

### July - December

The second half of the year saw several tropical cyclones form in the Australian region, including Tropical Cyclone Gabrielle and Severe Tropical Cyclone Kevin.

## South Pacific Ocean

The South Pacific Ocean cyclone season was near average in terms of activity, with 15 named storms, 5 tropical cyclones, and 2 severe tropical cyclones.

### January - June

The first half of the year saw several tropical cyclones form in the South Pacific Ocean, including Tropical Storm Cody and Tropical Storm Dovi.

### July - December

The second half of the year saw several tropical cyclones form in the South Pacific Ocean, including Tropical Cyclone Fili and Severe Tropical Cyclone Yasi.

article:
Takeoff (rapper)

Kirshnik Khari Ball, professionally known as Takeoff, was an American rapper, singer, and songwriter. He was best known as a member of the hip-hop trio Migos, alongside Quavo and Offset. Born on June 18, 1994, in Lawrenceville, Georgia, Takeoff's life was marked by a rapid rise to fame, followed by a tragic and untimely death.

#Early life

Takeoff was born to a family of modest means in Lawrenceville, Georgia. His parents, Edna Marshall and Kenneth Ball, raised him and his two siblings in a low-income household. Takeoff's early life was marked by a love for music, particularly hip-hop, which he developed at a young age. He attended Berkmar High School in Lilburn, Georgia, where he met his future Migos group members, Quavo and Offset. The three began rapping together in their teenage years, eventually forming Migos.

#Career

##2008â2018: Early work with Migos

Takeoff's music career began in 2008, when he, Quavo, and Offset formed Migos. The group gained a local following in Atlanta, releasing their debut mixtape, "Juug Season," in 2011. However, it was their 2013 single "Versace" that brought them widespread attention, with the song's catchy hook and infectious beat making it a viral hit.

Migos released their debut studio album, "Yung Rich Nation," in 2015, which featured the hit single "One Time." The album received generally positive reviews from critics and helped establish Migos as a rising force in hip-hop. Takeoff's contributions to the album were notable, with his unique vocal style and lyrical ability setting him apart from his group members.

Over the next few years, Migos released a string of successful albums and singles, including "Culture" (2017), "Bad and Boujee" (2016), and "Stir Fry" (2017). Takeoff's role in the group continued to grow, with him becoming an integral part of Migos' sound and image.

##2018â2021: The Last Rocket and later Migos work

In 2018, Takeoff released his debut solo album, "The Last Rocket." The album was a commercial success, debuting at number four on the US Billboard 200 chart and featuring the hit single "Last Memory." The album received positive reviews from critics, with many praising Takeoff's lyrical ability and unique vocal style.

Following the release of "The Last Rocket," Takeoff continued to work with Migos, releasing the album "Culture II" in 2018. The album was a commercial success, debuting at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart and featuring the hit singles "Stir Fry" and "Walk It Talk It."

In 2021, Migos released their fourth studio album, "Culture III." The album was a commercial success, debuting at number two on the US Billboard 200 chart and featuring the hit singles "Need It" and "Type Shit."

##2022: Friction within Migos and Only Built for Infinity Links

In 2022, Takeoff and Quavo began to pursue solo projects, with the two releasing the collaborative album "Only Built for Infinity Links" in October 2022. The album was a commercial success, debuting at number seven on the US Billboard 200 chart and featuring the hit single "Hotel Lobby."

Quavo, who was present at the scene of the shooting, was particularly devastated by Takeoff's death, with the two having been close friends and collaborators for many years.

##Investigation and legal proceedings

The investigation into Takeoff's death is ongoing, with the Houston Police Department working to identify the suspect and motive behind the shooting. In December 2022, a 33-year-old man named Patrick Xavier Clark was arrested and charged with Takeoff's murder.

##Funeral

**IOS 17**

iOS 17 is the seventeenth and upcoming major release of the iOS mobile operating system developed by Apple Inc. It is the successor to iOS 16 and is expected to be released in the fall of 2023.

**Early development**

The development of iOS 17 began in 2022, shortly after the release of iOS 16. Apple started testing the new operating system with a small group of developers and employees. The company also invited a select group of users to participate in the iOS 17 beta testing program, which allowed them to test the new features and provide feedback.

**System features**

The dock has been redesigned to be more compact, and the app icon grid has been adjusted to fit more icons on the screen. Additionally, users can now customize their Home Screen with new wallpapers and widgets.

iOS 17 introduces a new feature called StandBy, which allows users to interact with their iPhone while it is charging. When an iPhone is placed on a charging stand, it will enter StandBy mode, allowing users to access information such as the time, weather, and notifications.

The autocorrect and text prediction features in iOS 17 have been improved to provide more accurate suggestions. The operating system now uses machine learning algorithms to learn the user's typing habits and provide more relevant suggestions.

### Health

### Shortcuts

The Shortcuts app in iOS 17 has been updated to provide more features and functionality. The app now includes a new interface that makes it easier to create and manage shortcuts.

### Miscellaneous

iOS 17 includes several other miscellaneous apps and features, including a new app called Files and a new feature called Screen Time.

**Security and privacy**

article:
Cataract Surgery

Cataract surgery is a medical procedure that involves the removal of a cataract, a clouding of the lens of the eye that affects vision. It is one of the most common surgical procedures performed worldwide, with millions of operations taking place every year. The goal of cataract surgery is to improve vision by replacing the cloudy lens with an artificial one, known as an intraocular lens (IOL).

# Uses

Cataract surgery is primarily used to treat cataracts that are causing significant visual impairment. The procedure is usually recommended for individuals who experience one or more of the following symptoms:

* Blurred or cloudy vision
* Double vision
* Sensitivity to light
* Difficulty reading or watching television
* Difficulty driving or performing daily activities

Cataract surgery is also used to treat other conditions, such as congenital cataracts, which are present at birth, and secondary cataracts, which can develop as a result of other eye conditions or injuries.

# Techniques

There are several techniques used in cataract surgery, including:

## Phacoemulsification

Phacoemulsification is the most common technique used in cataract surgery. It involves the use of ultrasonic waves to break up the cataract, which is then suctioned out of the eye through a small incision. This technique is minimally invasive and allows for quick recovery.

## Manual Small Incision Cataract Surgery (MSICS)

MSICS is a technique that involves making a small incision in the eye and manually removing the cataract. This technique is often used in cases where phacoemulsification is not possible.

## Extracapsular Cataract Extraction (ECCE)

ECCE is a technique that involves making a larger incision in the eye and removing the cataract in one piece. This technique is often used in cases where the cataract is very large or where other complications are present.

# Pre-operative Evaluation

Before undergoing cataract surgery, patients undergo a comprehensive pre-operative evaluation to determine the best course of treatment.

## Contraindications

There are several contraindications for cataract surgery, including:

* Active eye infections
* Uncontrolled diabetes
* Uncontrolled hypertension
* Bleeding disorders

## Selection of Intraocular Lenses

The selection of an intraocular lens (IOL) is an important part of the pre-operative evaluation. IOLs come in different types, including monofocal, multifocal, and toric lenses. The type of IOL used depends on the individual's needs and preferences.

# Operation Procedures

The operation procedure for cataract surgery typically involves the following steps:

## Preparation

The patient is prepared for surgery by administering local anesthesia and positioning the patient under the microscope.

## Anaesthesia

Local anesthesia is used to numb the eye and prevent pain during the procedure.

## Phacoemulsification

The phacoemulsification procedure involves making a small incision in the eye and inserting a phacoemulsification probe. The probe uses ultrasonic waves to break up the cataract, which is then suctioned out of the eye.

## Manual Small Incision Cataract Surgery (MSICS)

The MSICS procedure involves making a small incision in the eye and manually removing the cataract.

## Extracapsular Cataract Extraction (ECCE)

The ECCE procedure involves making a larger incision in the eye and removing the cataract in one piece.

## Converting to ECCE to Manage a Contingency

In some cases, it may be necessary to convert to ECCE to manage a contingency, such as a complication during the procedure.

## Closing the Wound

The wound is closed with sutures or a sealant, depending on the type of procedure used.

# Post-operative Care

After the procedure, patients receive post-operative care to ensure a smooth recovery.

# Complications

As with any surgical procedure, there are potential complications associated with cataract surgery.

## During Surgery

Complications that can occur during surgery include:

* Retinal detachment
* Cataract rupture
* Infection

## After Surgery

Complications that can occur after surgery include:

* Infection
* Inflammation
* Dry eye

## Risk

The risk of complications depends on several factors, including the type of procedure used, the patient's overall health, and the surgeon's experience.

# Recovery and Rehabilitation

The recovery and rehabilitation process for cataract surgery typically involves the following steps:

* Resting the eye for a few days
* Using eye drops to help the eye heal
* Wearing protective glasses to protect the eye
* Following up with the surgeon to ensure a smooth recovery

# Outcomes

The outcomes for cataract surgery are generally excellent, with most patients experiencing significant improvement in their vision.

# History

Cataract surgery has a long history, dating back to ancient times. The first recorded cataract surgery was performed in ancient India in the 6th century BC.

# Accessibility

Cataract surgery is widely available in many parts of the world.

## Europe

In Europe, cataract surgery is widely available and is one of the most common surgical procedures performed.

## Asia

In Asia, cataract surgery is also widely available, with many countries offering high-quality care.

## Africa

In Africa, access to cataract surgery is limited in some areas, but many countries are working to improve access to care.

## Latin America

In Latin America, cataract surgery is widely available, with many countries offering high-quality care.

# Social, Economic, and Environmental Relevance

Cataract surgery has significant social, economic, and environmental relevance.

# Special Populations

Cataract surgery is also used to treat special populations, including:

## Congenital Cataracts

Congenital cataracts are cataracts that are present at birth. Cataract surgery is often used to treat congenital cataracts.

## Higher Risk for Operations on Separate Occasions

Shepherd Building Group

The Shepherd Building Group is a privately-owned construction company based in the United Kingdom. With a history spanning over 100 years, the company has established itself as a leading player in the construction industry, providing a range of services including building, civil engineering, and facilities management.

# History

## Main contractor

The Shepherd Building Group was founded in 1890 by a Yorkshire-based family. The company started as a small building contractor, undertaking local construction projects. Over the years, the company expanded its operations, taking on larger and more complex projects. In the mid-20th century, the company began to diversify its services, offering civil engineering and facilities management solutions to its clients.

## Manufactured products

In the 1960s, the Shepherd Building Group began to manufacture its own building products, including prefabricated buildings and structural steelwork. This move allowed the company to exert greater control over the quality of its projects and to reduce its reliance on external suppliers. The company's manufacturing division has since expanded to produce a range of products, including roofing systems, cladding, and glazing.

## Disposal of non-core businesses

In the 1990s and 2000s, the Shepherd Building Group underwent a period of significant change, disposing of several non-core businesses and focusing on its core construction and manufacturing activities. This process of consolidation allowed the company to streamline its operations, reduce costs, and improve its overall efficiency.

# Notable construction projects

The Shepherd Building Group has been involved in a number of high-profile construction projects over the years, including the redevelopment of the London Olympic Park, the construction of the Leeds Arena, and the refurbishment of the historic York Minster. These projects demonstrate the company's ability to deliver complex and large-scale construction projects to a high standard.

# Controversies

## Identity behind anonymous emails

In 2012, the Shepherd Building Group was at the center of a controversy surrounding a series of anonymous emails sent to local residents and businesses in the town of Selby, North Yorkshire. The emails, which were highly critical of the company's plans to develop a new housing estate in the area, were found to have been sent from a computer linked to the Shepherd Building Group. The company denied any involvement in the emails, but the incident raised questions about the company's transparency and accountability.

## Hand tool vibration

In 2015, the Shepherd Building Group was fined Â£100,000 by the Health and Safety Executive (HSE) after one of its employees was found to have developed a debilitating condition caused by the prolonged use of vibrating hand tools. The incident highlighted the company's failure to properly manage the risks associated with hand tool vibration and to provide adequate training to its employees.

## Domain name disputes

In 2018, the Shepherd Building Group was involved in a dispute with a rival construction company over the ownership of a domain name. The rival company had registered a domain name that was similar to the Shepherd Building Group's own website, and was using it to direct traffic to its own site. The Shepherd Building Group claimed that the rival company was engaging in "cyber squatting" and sought to have the domain name transferred to its own ownership.

## Employment blacklisting

In 2019, the Shepherd Building Group was accused of being involved in a construction industry blacklisting scandal, in which companies were found to have been secretly sharing information about workers who had been involved in trade union activity or had raised health and safety concerns. The company denied any involvement in the scandal, but the incident raised questions about the company's commitment to fair labor practices.

## Trinity Walk

In 2020, the Shepherd Building Group was involved in a controversy surrounding the redevelopment of the Trinity Walk shopping center in Wakefield, West Yorkshire. Local residents and businesses had raised concerns about the impact of the development on the local community, including the potential for increased traffic congestion and the loss of small businesses. The company was accused of failing to properly consult with local stakeholders and of prioritizing the interests of its own shareholders over those of the community.

Black Market in Wartime France

The black market in wartime France refers to the illicit trade and exchange of goods and services that occurred during the German occupation of France from 1940 to 1944. The black market was a widespread phenomenon that involved various segments of French society, including ordinary citizens, businesses, and even government officials. This article provides an overview of the background, development, and impact of the black market in wartime France.

Background

### 1930s: Inflation, Instability, and Unrest

The 1930s were a time of economic instability in France, marked by high inflation, unemployment, and social unrest. The global economic crisis of 1929 had a significant impact on France, leading to a decline in industrial production, rising unemployment, and increased poverty. The French government responded to the crisis by implementing a series of austerity measures, including price controls and rationing, which further exacerbated the economic situation.

### Fall of France

In May 1940, Germany launched a surprise attack on France, which led to the country's rapid defeat and occupation. The fall of France had a profound impact on the country's economy, leading to widespread shortages, price increases, and a decline in living standards. The German occupation authorities imposed strict controls on the economy, including rationing, price controls, and censorship, which further restricted the availability of goods and services.

1940-1941

### Origins

The black market in wartime France emerged as a response to the shortages and restrictions imposed by the German occupation authorities. The black market was characterized by the illicit trade and exchange of goods and services, including food, clothing, and other essential items.

#### Rationing and Price Controls

The German occupation authorities imposed strict rationing and price controls on the French economy, which led to widespread shortages and price increases. The rationing system was designed to ensure that essential goods were available to the population, but it was often ineffective and corrupt. The price controls, on the other hand, were designed to prevent price gouging, but they often had the opposite effect, leading to shortages and black market activity.

#### Diversion from Official Channels

The black market emerged as a response to the diversion of goods from official channels. Many French businesses and individuals began to divert goods from the official market to the black market, where they could be sold at higher prices. This diversion of goods was often facilitated by corrupt government officials and businessmen.

#### Clandestine Networks

The black market in wartime France was characterized by a network of clandestine relationships between buyers and sellers. These networks were often hidden from view, and they involved a range of individuals and organizations, including businessmen, farmers, and ordinary citizens.

#### Hidden Stockpiling

Hidden stockpiling was a key feature of the black market in wartime France. Many individuals and businesses began to stockpile goods, including food and other essential items, in secret locations. These stockpiles were often hidden from view, and they were used to supply the black market.

#### Grey Market

The grey market was a key feature of the black market in wartime France. The grey market referred to the trade in goods that were not strictly illegal but were not officially sanctioned either. The grey market was characterized by the trade in goods such as tobacco, coffee, and chocolate, which were not essential but were highly sought after.

### Users of the Black Market

The black market in wartime France was used by a range of individuals and organizations, including ordinary citizens, businesses, and government officials.

#### Privileged French

The privileged French, including businessmen, politicians, and high-ranking officials, were among the main users of the black market. These individuals often had access to goods and services that were not available to the general population, and they used the black market to acquire luxury items and other goods.

#### Occupation Forces

The German occupation forces were also major users of the black market in wartime France. The occupation forces used the black market to acquire goods and services that were not available through official channels, including food, clothing, and other essential items.

### Public Response

The public response to the black market in wartime France was complex and multifaceted.

#### Early Condemnation

The black market was initially condemned by the French public, who saw it as a corrupt and immoral institution. Many French citizens were outraged by the prices and shortages that characterized the black market, and they called for strict measures to be taken against those who participated in it.

#### Participation

Despite the initial condemnation, many French citizens began to participate in the black market as the war dragged on. The black market offered a way for individuals to acquire goods and services that were not available through official channels, and many people saw it as a necessary evil.

#### Housewives' Demonstrations

Housewives' demonstrations were a key feature of the public response to the black market in wartime France. Many housewives, who were responsible for managing the household budget and acquiring goods and services, began to demonstrate against the high prices and shortages that characterized the black market.

#### Suspicions of Hoarding

Many French citizens suspected that the black market was controlled by hoarders and speculators who were profiteering from the shortages and price increases. These suspicions were often fueled by rumors and propaganda, and they contributed to the widespread resentment of the black market.

#### Official Antisemitism

The French government and occupation authorities often blamed the black market on Jews and other minority groups. This official antisemitism was used to justify strict measures against the black market, including arrests, fines, and other penalties.

#### Public Opinion

Public opinion on the black market in wartime France was complex and multifaceted. Many French citizens saw the black market as a necessary evil, while others condemned it as corrupt and immoral.

#### Political Opposition

The black market was also opposed by many politicians and activists, who saw it as a symbol of the corruption and inefficiency of the French government and occupation authorities.

### Response by Authorities

The response of the authorities to the black market in wartime France was complex and multifaceted.

The French government and occupation authorities implemented a range of measures to combat the black market, including arrests, fines, and other penalties. However, these measures were often ineffective, and the black market continued to thrive.

Widespread Black Market (Autumn 1941 to 1943)

### Agricultural Black Market

The agricultural black market was a key feature of the widespread black market in wartime France. Many farmers began to sell their produce on the black market, where they could get higher prices than through official channels.

The commerce and industry sectors were also affected by the widespread black market. Many businesses began to use the black market to acquire goods and services that were not available through official channels.

### Tacit Tolerance

The authorities began to tolerate the black market, as they realized that it was a necessary evil. Many officials and businessmen saw the black market as a way to acquire goods and services that were not available through official channels, and they began to turn a blind eye to its activities.

#### Milice vs the Black Market

The Milice, a French paramilitary organization, was established to combat the black market and other forms of resistance. However, the Milice was often corrupt and ineffective, and it failed to eradicate the black market.

### Fraud and Resistance

The black market became increasingly linked to the resistance movement during this period.

#### Resistance Encouragement

Many resistance groups encouraged the black market as a way to subvert the occupation authorities and acquire goods and services. The resistance saw the black market as a way to survive and continue their activities.

#### Blaming the Resistance

The authorities began to blame the resistance for the black market, rather than acknowledging its widespread nature. This blame game allowed the authorities to justify their crackdown on the resistance and the black market.

#### End of the Occupation

The end of the occupation in the summer of 1944 marked a significant turning point for the black market in France. Many of the restrictions and shortages that had characterized the occupation were lifted, and the black market began to decline.

#### Confiscation of Illicit Profits

The government confiscated many of the illicit profits that had been made during the occupation. This confiscation process allowed the government to recover some of the losses that had been incurred during the war.

### Continued Black Market Operations

Despite the efforts of the government to eradicate the black market, it continued to exist in some form.

#### Continued Trafficking

Many individuals and businesses continued to traffic in goods and services on the black market. This continued trafficking allowed the black market to survive, albeit in a reduced form.

article:
Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore

Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore is a 2022 fantasy film directed by David Yates and written by J.K. Rowling and Steve Kloves. The film is the third installment in the Fantastic Beasts film series and a spin-off of the Harry Potter film series. It is set in the 1930s, several years after the events of the previous film, and follows magizoologist Newt Scamander and his friends as they face a new threat to the wizarding world.

#Plot

The film takes place in the 1930s, several years after the events of Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald. Newt Scamander (Eddie Redmayne) is struggling to maintain his magizoology work while navigating his complicated relationships with his brother Theseus (Callum Turner) and his friend Tina Goldstein (Katherine Waterston). Meanwhile, Albus Dumbledore (Jude Law) is facing increasing pressure from the wizarding community to confront the dark wizard Gellert Grindelwald (Mads Mikkelsen), who has gained significant power and influence.

As tensions rise, Newt, Theseus, and Tina embark on a mission to stop Grindelwald and his followers, who are seeking to gain control over the wizarding world. Along the way, they are joined by other allies, including the young wizard Eulalie Hicks (Victoria Yeates) and the mysterious Credence Barebone (Ezra Miller). As the story unfolds, the group faces numerous challenges and dangers, including treacherous landscapes, ferocious creatures, and treacherous foes.

Throughout the film, the characters grapple with complex moral dilemmas and confront their own personal demons. Newt struggles to balance his love for his brother and his duty to the wizarding world, while Albus Dumbledore faces difficult choices about how to confront Grindelwald and protect the greater good.

#Cast

The film features an ensemble cast, including:

* Eddie Redmayne as Newt Scamander
* Jude Law as Albus Dumbledore
* Mads Mikkelsen as Gellert Grindelwald
* Ezra Miller as Credence Barebone
* Katherine Waterston as Tina Goldstein
* Callum Turner as Theseus Scamander
* Victoria Yeates as Eulalie Hicks
* Dan Fogler as Jacob Kowalski
* Jessica Williams as Eulalie Hicks
* William Nadylam as Yusuf Kama

#Production

##Development

The film was first announced in October 2016, when Warner Bros. Pictures and J.K. Rowling announced plans to create a five-film series based on the Fantastic Beasts franchise. David Yates was confirmed to direct the film, with J.K. Rowling and Steve Kloves set to write the screenplay.

##Casting

The film's cast was announced in November 2020, with Eddie Redmayne, Jude Law, and Mads Mikkelsen confirmed to reprise their roles from the previous films. Ezra Miller, Katherine Waterston, and Callum Turner were also confirmed to return, while Victoria Yeates, Dan Fogler, and Jessica Williams were announced as new additions to the cast.

##Filming

Principal photography on the film began in September 2020 and wrapped in February 2022. The film was shot on location in the United Kingdom, Germany, and Italy, with additional filming taking place at Warner Bros. Studios in Leavesden, England.

#Marketing

The film's marketing campaign began in December 2021, with the release of a teaser trailer. The trailer featured footage of the film's characters and settings, as well as a glimpse of the story's central conflict. Additional trailers and promotional materials were released in the months leading up to the film's release.

#Release

##Theatrical

The film was released in the United States on April 15, 2022, and in the United Kingdom on April 8, 2022. It was released in IMAX and Dolby Cinema formats, as well as in standard 2D and 3D.

##Censorship

The film was rated PG-13 in the United States for "sequences of fantasy violence and action." It was also rated 12A in the United Kingdom for "moderate fantasy violence."

##Home media

The film was released on digital platforms on June 28, 2022, and on DVD and Blu-ray on July 26, 2022.

#Reception

##Box office

The film grossed over $405 million worldwide, making it the highest-grossing film of 2022. It was a commercial success, despite receiving mixed reviews from critics.

##Critical response

The film received mixed reviews from critics, with some praising its visuals and performances while others criticized its storytelling and pacing. The film holds a 47% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 242 reviews, with an average rating of 5.5/10.

##Accolades

The film was nominated for two Academy Awards, including Best Visual Effects and Best Production Design. It also received nominations for two BAFTA Awards and two Critics' Choice Movie Awards.

#Future

The film is the third installment in the Fantastic Beasts film series, with two additional films planned. The fourth film is scheduled for release in 2024, with the fifth and final film set for release in 2026.
